skillTree.localised_description: Hand-picked by Lord Xlotc himself, these custodians are the strongest of their kind and, as such, are expected to protect the Sacred Pools with their lives.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

Armour: +10 for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

Melee defence: +4 for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

Enables ability "Elite Guardians" for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

Melee attack: +4 for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

Armour: +10 for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

Melee defence: +4 for Blessed spawn
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: “Let us show these interlopers the true wrath of Lustria!”

effects.description:
Enables Awakened Forest attrition
	(enemy armies in local province)

Immune to Awakened Forest attrition
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Like most other Slann, Lord Xlotc is shadowed by Skink attendants who aid him in basic tasks. However, these Skinks in particular have been trained to ride alongside their Slann lord into battle, raining javelins onto any foe that crosses their path.
The power to move objects without touching them makes missiles attacks against this one largely pointless.
Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.
The power of the Old Ones, stored for future use so that - at precisely the right time - the Great Plan may be advanced.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +10

skillTree.localised_description: Contemplation is the path to alignment, to the correct interpretation of the Great Plan.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -15
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: All shall be one, as it is written.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Cold, merciless, without pity, obeying only logic. Hardened against magic's ill-effects.
Lord Xlotc has taken it upon himself to guard these magical waters from the greedy hands of Lustria’s interpolators.

effects.description:
Hidden effect to grant Fear along with Terror
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 during forest battles
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Priests of the Third Generation are revered by their cold-blooded kin, for they carry with them millennia of knowledge.
The greedy and insane Harkon remains a menace; our treasure vaults will never be safe while he and his ilk remain. The undead-spawn have terrorised our shores long enough!

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -20 with Vampire Coast and Vampire Counts

Leadership: +8 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mastering two lores of magic is a peak few mortals reach. Xlotc was blessed with an aptitude for the lores of Life & Light, having honed his skills over the centuries.

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Life spells
Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Light spells

skillTree.localised_description: Few are given the honour of bathing in the Sacred Pools. The warriors of the Warden, however, are mandated to bathe themselves in the healing waters before and after battle to ensure they remain healthy and robust.
These gifts of the Old Ones must be protected from plunderers at all costs!

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: “Manspawn. Elfspawn. Ratspawn. Deadspawn. All these invaders must be driven out of our sacred jungles!”

effects.description:
Armies replenish in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% when fighting against all Lustrian invaders
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Frenzy" when fighting against all Lustrian invaders
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries of overseeing the First City, through all the attempts to destroy it, has bolstered Xlotc’s mystical abilities to heights incomprehensible to mortals.
Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Earth Blood Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker
Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Through millennia of study, total mastery over magic may be attained.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A long-serving member of an ancient, honourable tradition.

Melee attack: +4 for Saurus units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Saurus units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Saurus units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This seasoned warrior understands irregular combat perfectly: when to attack, when to hold back, when to withdraw behind heavier lines.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the finest beast riders can hang on whilst their mounts crash through the jungle undergrowth or smash through the foe's ranks.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is a great honour to direct the elite warriors who protect the Plan from calamity.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Kroxigor, Sacred Kroxigor and Temple Guard units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The most intelligent hunter tends to move swiftly up the chain of command.

Melee attack: +4 for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Feral Carnosaur and Dread Saurian units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The largest, most aggressive creatures - usually the oldest bulls of the herd - must be directed, lest their independent spirit lead them astray.

Weapon strength: +6% for Stegadon, Feral Troglodon, Ancient Salamander and Bastiladon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The unforgiving law of the jungle is most clear on matters of ascendancy.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Saurus and Temple Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Saurus and Temple Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Saurus and Temple Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Braves who emerge from the same spawning often share a deep connection – a bond which provides considerable advantages in battle.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Skinks, Chameleon Skinks, Red Crested Skinks, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Packs, Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Skinks, Chameleon Skinks, Red Crested Skinks, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Packs, Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skinks, Chameleon Skinks, Red Crested Skinks, Salamander and Razordon Hunting Packs, Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mount and rider, together as one at their very cores. Indivisible.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, and Coatl units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, and Coatl units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Cold One, Terradon Riders, Ripperdactyl Riders, and Coatl units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You need to be at the very centre of this pack of furious monsters to have the minutest chance of controlling their rage. Good luck!

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ancient Salamander, Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon and Dread Saurian units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Ancient Salamander, Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon and Dread Saurian units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ancient Salamander, Bastiladon, Stegadon, Feral Carnosaur, Feral Troglodon and Dread Saurian units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The power generated by the overarching Geomantic Web can also be used to nourish the Saurus on the march.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Life in the jungle means knowing the difference between which flora can heal and what, if ingested, will kill you.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can fire while on the move.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

effects.description:
Range: +15% for Razordon Hunting Packs, Salamander Hunting Packs & Ancient Salamanders
	(all armies)

Melee attack: +8 for Razordon Hunting Packs, Salamander Hunting Packs & Ancient Salamanders
	(all armies)
Once the Deadspawn that taints Lustria have been dealt with, the Worldroots will become travesible to our forces.

items.colour_text: A palanquin unlike those of other Slann, this floating nexus of magic is topped with a life gem that carries a small portion of water from the Sacred Pools. The reinvigoration granted by this radiant gem is almost as potent as bathing in the actual Pools.
An ornately designed mace used to direct powerful spells at nearby enemies.

effects.description: Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

effects.description:
Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds for embedded Skink Priest Heroes, Skink Oracle Heroes & Coatl units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

effects.description: Enables "Dazed" contact effect (reduced Speed and Melee Defence)

items.colour_text: In times of war, Lord Xlotc dons pieces of sacred armour from the vaults of Itza to strengthen himself, both physically and magically.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The other Lizardmen most revere Slann of the Third Generation. Lord Xlotc is no exception, tasked with overseeing Itza and its nearby sites.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
